channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report E-2023120230
item.description:
Report E-2023120230

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-20T18:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAE experienced a UN1791 Extract-2 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 ounces of material released to the drum lid due to a faulty bung cap. The bung cap was replaced, and the drum was wiped down and neutralized. The damaged cap, PPE, and impacted rags were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120349
item.description:
Report X-2023120349

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: TWO BOTTLES WERE CRUSHED AND LEAKING OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023120338
item.description:
Report X-2023120338

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120338 SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS DOING A DOCK WALK, THEY WERE INFORMED OF THIS PACKAGE LEAKING. THEY WENT OVER TO THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE ARE WITH THE FOLD ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS SECURE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE AND SOME OF THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSROB. 2.X-2023120342 SequenceEvent: Package was called out to QA while doing a dock walk. The package was placed in a plastic lined tote and brought to QA for examination DescribePack: One bottle had a punctured seal under the vented cap. This allowed contents to leak out and damage the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated in a plastic lined tote and brought to QA for inspection and processing

item.title: Report X-2023120336
item.description:
Report X-2023120336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFOMRED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION AND QA CAME OVER WITH A RED TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE AND MADE SURE THE AREA WAS CLEANED AND SAFE. THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IT IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE WHICH CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A RED TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2023120482
item.description:
Report X-2023120482

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120482 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND MOVED IT TO THE END OF THE TRAILER AND NOTIFIED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION AND QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG, FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED ONE OF THE CONTAINERS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB. 2. X-2023120485 SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS CLEANING UP A SPILL, THEY NOTICED THIS WAS ALSO IN THE SAME TRAILER AND WAS WET. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH FOLD ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE QA AREA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU ONE OF THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB. 3. X-2023120488 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS PICKING OFF THE IC BELT, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND POSSIBLY LEAKING. THEY PLACED IT THE FLOOR AND INFORMED THE MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA THE SITUATION THEY HAD. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA. THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS AN OXIDIZER AND PLACED IN THE TOTE. QA MADE SURE THE AREA WAS SAFE AND SECURE. THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED ONE OF THE CONTAINERS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

  • Description: X-2023120163-SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER THEN QA WAS NOTIFIED. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE JERRICAN HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. X-2023120166--2023120166 SequenceEvent: THE MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE JERRICAN WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2023120122
item.description:
Report E-2023120122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and one their dock in Kansas City, KC. The spill consisted of approximately 5 ounces of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50, which released from one of the small tubes at the bottom of (1) empty 330 gallon metal tote. The terminal stated the tote only had residue inside of the tote. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they wiped up the spill with absorbents and placed the spilled contents into a 5 gallon poly drum that was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120081
item.description:
Report X-2023120081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded and the package was discovered underneath several tires. The box and the bag inside the box had a tear in it causing it to leak contents. DescribePack: There is a tear at the bottom of the plastic bag DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a tote and removed from the other packages. Any wet package was removed from the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2023120052
item.description:
Report X-2023120052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered underneath another package that had been placed next to trailer to be loaded before the trailer was closed. Package was leaking and had leaked onto another Hazmat package that was underneath it. DescribePack: One of the bottles is dented and cracked causing leaking. Another bottle is dented but is not leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was placed in a tote and removed from other packages.
